Berasnya Nggak Laku di Pasar, Bulog Terancam Tak Bisa Bayar Utang
01 Nov 2019, 09:52 by Vadhia Lidyana


Foto: Adhar Muttaqin

Jakarta - Direktur Utama Bulog Budi Waseso mengatakan lembaga yang dipimpinnya tengah menghadapi permasalahan berat. Perusahaan pelat merah ini tengah seret pendapatannya lantaran cadangan beras miliknya tak bisa terserap pasar.Karena pendapatannya seret, Bulog terancam tak bisa memenuhi kewajibannya seperti membayar utang. Utang yang dimaksud, digunakan Bulog untuk mengimpor beras penugasan pemerintah."Kita dapat penugasan dari negara untuk impor beras contohnya, ini kan beras CBP, tapi yang mengimpor dan membeli Bulog, uangnya pinjam, utangnya Bulog. Ini masalah besar, karena nilainya triliunan dan bunganya komersial. Sedangkan CBP ini tidak bisa kita jual belikan kecuali ada penugasan," ungkap Buwas dalam acara Ngopi BUMN, di kantor Kementerian BUMN, Jakarta, Jumat (1/11/2019).Perlu diketahui, saat ini Bulog memiliki stok beras berupa Cadangan Beras Pemerintah (CBP) sebanyak 2,3 juta ton yang di dalamnya terdiri dari 900.000 ton beras eks-impor dari tahun 2018."Stok CBP 2,3 juta ton. Masih ada eks-impor tahun lalu sekitar 900.000 ton dari totalnya 1,8 juta ton. 2,3 juta ton itu total CBP saja," terang Buwas.Sulitnya beras Bulog menembus pasar membuat keuangan perusahaan pelat merah ini terganggu. Bukan hanya untuk bayar utang, tapi juga untuk memenuhi biaya operasional.Ancaman yang mendera Bulog tentu bukan main-main. Asisten Deputi Usaha Industri Agro dan Farmasi II Kementerian BUMN, Agus Suharyono mengungkap, bunga utang yang harus ditanggung Bulog nilainya cukup besar hingga Rp 10 miliar. "Bunga itu catatan kami hampir Rp 10 miliar, satu hari. Beliau (Buwas) juga harus menyiapkan 4 ribu karyawan yang tiap hari membutuhkan Rp 6 miliar," tutur Agus.Permasalahan ini sendiri tengah menjadi sorotan serius Kementerian BUMN, dan tengah dicarikan jalan keluarnya. The rice does not sell at the market, Bulog is threatened that it cannot pay debt
01 Nov 2019, 09:52 by Vadhia Lidyana


Photo: Adhar Muttaqin

Jakarta - Bulog President Director Budi Waseso said the institution he leads is facing severe problems. The state-owned company is dragging its income down because its rice reserves cannot be absorbed by the market. Because of its sluggish incomes, Bulog is threatened that it cannot fulfill its obligations such as paying off debt. The intended debt is used by Bulog to import government-assigned rice. "We can get an assignment from the state to import rice, for example, this is CBP rice, but those who import and buy Bulog, borrow money, borrow Bulog. This is a big problem, because the value is trillions and interest commercial. Whereas CBP cannot be bought or sold unless there is an assignment, "said Buwas at the BUMN Coffee Cup event, at the BUMN Ministry office, Jakarta, Friday (11/01/2019). It should be known, Bulog currently has rice stocks in the form of Rice Reserves The government (CBP) as much as 2.3 million tons which consists of 900,000 tons of ex-imported rice from 2018. "CBP stock of 2.3 million tons. There are still ex-imports last year of around 900,000 tons of a total of 1.8 million tons. 2.3 million tons is a total of CBP alone, "explained Buwas. The difficulty of Bulog rice penetrating the market has made the state-owned company financially disrupted. Not just to pay debts, but also to meet operational costs. The threat to whack Bulog is certainly not playing games. The Assistant Deputy of Agro and Pharmaceutical Industry Business II of the Ministry of BUMN, Agus Suharyono, revealed that the debt interest that must be borne by the National Logistics Agency is large enough to reach Rp 10 billion. "Our interest is almost IDR 10 billion, one day. He (Buwas) also has to prepare 4 thousand employees who need IDR 6 billion every day," said Agus. This problem itself is currently a serious focus of the Ministry of SOEs, and a solution is being sought. .
